attributes.action: Asses the self-employed earnings criteria for 30 hours free childcare COVID-19
attributes.additional_details: The minimum earning criteria is £7.25k  per financial year, given the impact of COVID-19 this may not be attainable by some self employed due to the restrictions the government have imposed since March and therefore they will not be eligible for the 30 hours free childcare that they would normally get, this is especially true to new(er) businesses that were not entitled to the SEISS grants, and businesses outside the scope of any other grants or loans.
attributes.background: Change the self employed earning criteria assessment period from yearly income to quarterly, enabling self employed people affected by COVID-19 between March and September to be eligible for this much needed support in the next school term and enable them to return to work and support the economy.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The rules for free childcare include both quarterly and annual estimates of incomes. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/tax-free-childcare
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
